intro: Scheidweileria incisoserrata, commonly known as the serrated scheidweileria, is a rare and distinctive member of the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves with finely serrated edges, which give it its scientific name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense, composite inflorescences, typical of the daisy family. It is native to specific regions in South America, particularly in Brazil, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
